content.description: Hard start from the ground to good holds by first bolt. A few reachy moves by rounded flake to easier climbing for last two clips. Finish to anchors of Sinister Exaggerator. Rated 11d though I thought it was easier than Sinister.
content.protection: 6 bolts and two-bolt anchor with rap hangers.

content.description: Climb face into chimney and cracks left of the Pillar or “Thor’s Handle”. (From The Granite Dells Climbing Guide by Kevin Keith)
content.location: Left of the pillar on the middle left of Thor’s wall.

content.description: S curve up steep face past 3 bolts to ledge.  Continue up face past two more bolts to a two bolt anchor.  (From The Granite Dells Climbing Guide by Kevin Keith)
content.location: Left side of Thor’s wall.  Left of monarch.

content.description: Radical sidepulling, pinching and crimping up an overhanging wall. Begin atop a short detached pillar and make technical, demanding moves past several bolts to the ledge at the top. Sustained! Might feel a bit reachy in spots. This route receives an 11d/12a rating in the Falcon guide, so take that for what it's worth.
content.location: Near the middle of the wall to the right of the massive left-trending flake, start atop a large detached pillar and go straight up. Rap the route, or top belay the second and walk off.

content.description: Fun route with interesting crack moves at the top.  The three bolts at the start protect the crux.
content.protection: Three bolts and gear for the crack.  Build a station  at the top or use rappel station.  Bring long slings or cord to build anchor.
content.location: This route starts immediately left of a large left-leaning crack.  Walk down to the left.

content.description: Fun route with crux between the first and second bolt.  Varied climbing with interesting moves.  Without a good catch a fall at the first bolt could result in ground-fall.
content.protection: Two bolts and gear.  Natural anchor at the top or traverse left and belay from rap bolts.
content.location: This route starts on the right side of a unique pillar on the right portion of the wall.  Rappel from station.

content.description:
The Rock Climbing Arizona Falcon guide calls this a 5.10b. Clip the first bolt and lie-back a seam until you get a jug next to the second bolt. This is really the only move that might be in the 10b range. Seems like more of a 10a tops to me. Follow the good holds up past the third bolt to a two bolt anchor. 

  This route can be set up as a TR if you scramble around to the right and walk out on the ledge to the anchor bolts.
content.protection: Three bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This climb is the second bolted climb from the right on Thor's Wall.

content.description: North facing, steep wall with many moderate to hard routes. Variety of bolted and gear protected routes. Good rock.  Some bouldering, too.
